content.raw: There should be some consideration for the condition where the filter refers to chromosomes/regions not found in the genomedata archive. Currently it will raise a KeyError (e.g. "KeyError: 'Could not find chromosome: chr10'") if a chromosome in the filter is not found in the archive.
content.html: There should be some consideration for the condition where the filter refers to chromosomes/regions not found in the genomedata archive. Currently it will raise a KeyError (e.g. "KeyError: 'Could not find chromosome: chr10'") if a chromosome in the filter is not found in the archive.

content.raw: Fixes are coming along with changes to performance. Currently as-is, regions are filtered out at 1 region/second. This is far too slow for practical use.
content.html: Fixes are coming along with changes to performance. Currently as-is, regions are filtered out at 1 region/second. This is far too slow for practical use.

content.raw:
All PR feedback has been applied along with major nomenclature changes. Namely renaming from "filter" to "hard mask".


Speed was improved roughly 30x fold but it is not sufficient for genome-wide applications unless the number of mask regions is relatively small.
content.html:
All PR feedback has been applied along with major nomenclature changes. Namely renaming from "filter" to "hard mask".

Speed was improved roughly 30x fold but it is not sufficient for genome-wide applications unless the number of mask regions is relatively small.

content.raw: @hoffman this is ready for your review again
content.html: @hoffman this is ready for your review again

content.raw: Also of note, the command genomedata-hard-mask does not support genomedata filename globs. This wouldn't be too difficult but it would require a somewhat significant amount of code (mostly trackname book keeping) and tests to cover the globbed genomedata names. I've omitted for now in favor of opening an issue unless there's feedback that it should be included in this PR specifically.
content.html: Also of note, the command genomedata-hard-mask does not support genomedata filename globs. This wouldn't be too difficult but it would require a somewhat significant amount of code (mostly trackname book keeping) and tests to cover the globbed genomedata names. I've omitted for now in favor of opening an issue unless there's feedback that it should be included in this PR specifically.
